column4: This is so confusing. I have tried everything I can think of but cannot for the life of me get logged into mysql whether by term, webmin, phpmyadmin, etc.... I have tried changing the root password and still nothing. I am LOST!
is the mysql server on the localhost of the system you are trying to access?
if it's localhost,  then why can't you access http://localhost/phpmyadmin ?
-->  ERROR 1045 (28000): Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: YES)
oh you lost the root password or you forgot the user password pair?
nope.... I have NEVER been able to log into mysql in any way at all.... tried changing the root password from Ubuntu's default ways and still nothing
but the login screen of phpmyadmin comes up?
nope. I can't even get through the phpmyadmin install. but via webmin it comes up and I get the same error there and in terminal I get the same error
sound like with whatever method of install or something you have corrupted the lamp set,  just remove --purge the set and start from some know state
what mneptok: says is true root system and mysql root are not the same
webmin?  oh that's might be what started his problems
adding problems on top of other problems just makes it harder to correct

one can only be "adding" problems if they are aware that something is a problem... I never actually knew that Ubuntu didn't support Webmin. Which sucks. webmin is a good tool as it provides access to everything
I agree webmin would be a good tool if it was supported but at this time it's not so if you fix it and update it then we will all be happy
It could be running the fsck to test your drives after a bad shutdown it might take some time depending on size of disk
oh but that should be displayed
might try hold the shift key at boot to get to the grub menu and try select the rescue mode as an option if it fails to boot
